linegroup.line: O, I am slain!

section.para: IAGO from behind wounds CASSIO in the leg, and exit

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: I am maim'd for ever. Help, ho! murder! murder!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: The voice of Cassio: Iago keeps his word.

linegroup.speaker: RODERIGO
linegroup.line: O, villain that I am!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: It is even so.

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: O, help, ho! light! a surgeon!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: 'Tis he:--O brave Iago, honest and just,
That hast such noble sense of thy friend's wrong!
Thou teachest me. Minion, your dear lies dead,
And your unblest fate hies: strumpet, I come.
Forth of my heart those charms, thine eyes, are blotted;
Thy bed, lust-stain'd, shall with lust's blood be spotted.

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: What, ho! no watch? no passage? murder! murder!

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: 'Tis some mischance; the cry is very direful.

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: O, help!

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: Hark!

linegroup.speaker: RODERIGO
linegroup.line: O wretched villain!

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: Two or three groan: it is a heavy night:
These may be counterfeits: let's think't unsafe
To come in to the cry without more help.

linegroup.speaker: RODERIGO
linegroup.line: Nobody come? then shall I bleed to death.

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: Hark!

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: Here's one comes in his shirt, with light and weapons.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Who's there? whose noise is this that ones on murder?

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: We do not know.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Did not you hear a cry?

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: Here, here! for heaven's sake, help me!

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: What's the matter?

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: This is Othello's ancient, as I take it.

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: The same indeed; a very valiant fellow.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: What are you here that cry so grievously?

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: Iago? O, I am spoil'd, undone by villains!
Give me some help.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: O me, lieutenant! what villains have done this?

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: I think that one of them is hereabout,
And cannot make away.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: O treacherous villains!
What are you there? come in, and give some help.

linegroup.speaker: RODERIGO
linegroup.line: O, help me here!

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: That's one of them.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: O murderous slave! O villain!

linegroup.speaker: RODERIGO
linegroup.line: O damn'd Iago! O inhuman dog!

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Kill men i' the dark!--Where be these bloody thieves?--
How silent is this town!--Ho! murder! murder!--
What may you be? are you of good or evil?

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: As you shall prove us, praise us.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Signior Lodovico?

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: He, sir.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: I cry you mercy. Here's Cassio hurt by villains.

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: Cassio!

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: How is't, brother!

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: My leg is cut in two.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Marry, heaven forbid!
Light, gentlemen; I'll bind it with my shirt.

linegroup.speaker: BIANCA
linegroup.line: What is the matter, ho? who is't that cried?

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Who is't that cried!

linegroup.speaker: BIANCA
linegroup.line: O my dear Cassio! my sweet Cassio! O Cassio,
Cassio, Cassio!

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: O notable strumpet! Cassio, may you suspect
Who they should be that have thus many led you?

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: No.

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: I am to find you thus: I have been to seek you.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Lend me a garter. So. O, for a chair,
To bear him easily hence!

linegroup.speaker: BIANCA
linegroup.line: Alas, he faints! O Cassio, Cassio, Cassio!

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Gentlemen all, I do suspect this trash
To be a party in this injury.
Patience awhile, good Cassio. Come, come;
Lend me a light. Know we this face or no?
Alas my friend and my dear countryman
Roderigo! no:--yes, sure: O heaven! Roderigo.

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: What, of Venice?

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Even he, sir; did you know him?

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: Know him! ay.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Signior Gratiano? I cry you gentle pardon;
These bloody accidents must excuse my manners,
That so neglected you.

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: I am glad to see you.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: How do you, Cassio? O, a chair, a chair!

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: Roderigo!

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: He, he 'tis he.
O, that's well said; the chair!

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: Some good man bear him carefully from hence;
I'll fetch the general's surgeon.
For you, mistress,
Save you your labour. He that lies slain
here, Cassio,
Was my dear friend: what malice was between you?

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: None in the world; nor do I know the man.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: To BIANCA What, look you pale? O, bear him out
o' the air.
linegroup.para: CASSIO and RODERIGO are borne off
linegroup.line: Stay you, good gentlemen. Look you pale, mistress?
Do you perceive the gastness of her eye?
Nay, if you stare, we shall hear more anon.
Behold her well; I pray you, look upon her:
Do you see, gentlemen? nay, guiltiness will speak,
Though tongues were out of use.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: 'Las, what's the matter? what's the matter, husband?

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Cassio hath here been set on in the dark
By Roderigo and fellows that are scaped:
He's almost slain, and Roderigo dead.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Alas, good gentleman! alas, good Cassio!

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: This is the fruit of whoring. Prithee, Emilia,
Go know of Cassio where he supp'd to-night.
What, do you shake at that?

linegroup.speaker: BIANCA
linegroup.line: He supp'd at my house; but I therefore shake not.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: O, did he so? I charge you, go with me.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Fie, fie upon thee, strumpet!

linegroup.speaker: BIANCA
linegroup.line: I am no strumpet; but of life as honest
As you that thus abuse me.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: As I! foh! fie upon thee!

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Kind gentlemen, let's go see poor Cassio dress'd.
Come, mistress, you must tell's another tale.
Emilia run you to the citadel,
And tell my lord and lady what hath happ'd.
Will you go on? I pray.
This is the night
That either makes me or fordoes me quite.

section.title: SCENE II. A bedchamber in the castle: DESDEMONA in bed asleep; a light burning.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: It is the cause, it is the cause, my soul,--
Let me not name it to you, you chaste stars!--
It is the cause. Yet I'll not shed her blood;
Nor scar that whiter skin of hers than snow,
And smooth as monumental alabaster.
Yet she must die, else she'll betray more men.
Put out the light, and then put out the light:
If I quench thee, thou flaming minister,
I can again thy former light restore,
Should I repent me: but once put out thy light,
Thou cunning'st pattern of excelling nature,
I know not where is that Promethean heat
That can thy light relume. When I have pluck'd the rose,
I cannot give it vital growth again.
It must needs wither: I'll smell it on the tree.
Ah balmy breath, that dost almost persuade
Justice to break her sword! One more, one more.
Be thus when thou art dead, and I will kill thee,
And love thee after. One more, and this the last:
So sweet was ne'er so fatal. I must weep,
But they are cruel tears: this sorrow's heavenly;
It strikes where it doth love. She wakes.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: Who's there? Othello?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Ay. Desdemona.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: Will you come to bed, my lord?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Have you pray'd to-night, Desdemona?

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: Ay, my lord.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: If you bethink yourself of any crime
Unreconciled as yet to heaven and grace,
Solicit for it straight.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: Alas, my lord, what do you mean by that?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Well, do it, and be brief; I will walk by:
I would not kill thy unprepared spirit;
No; heaven forfend! I would not kill thy soul.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: Talk you of killing?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Ay, I do.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: Then heaven
Have mercy on me!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Amen, with all my heart!

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: If you say so, I hope you will not kill me.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Hum!

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: And yet I fear you; for you are fatal then
When your eyes roll so: why I should fear I know not,
Since guiltiness I know not; but yet I feel I fear.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Think on thy sins.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: They are loves I bear to you.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Ay, and for that thou diest.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: That death's unnatural that kills for loving.
Alas, why gnaw you so your nether lip?
Some bloody passion shakes your very frame:
These are portents; but yet I hope, I hope,
They do not point on me.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Peace, and be still!

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: I will so. What's the matter?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: That handkerchief which I so loved and gave thee
Thou gavest to Cassio.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: No, by my life and soul!
Send for the man, and ask him.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Sweet soul, take heed,
Take heed of perjury; thou art on thy deathbed.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: Ay, but not yet to die.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Yes, presently:
Therefore confess thee freely of thy sin;
For to deny each article with oath
Cannot remove nor choke the strong conception
That I do groan withal. Thou art to die.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: Then Lord have mercy on me!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: I say, amen.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: And have you mercy too! I never did
Offend you in my life; never loved Cassio
But with such general warranty of heaven
As I might love: I never gave him token.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: By heaven, I saw my handkerchief in's hand.
O perjured woman! thou dost stone my heart,
And makest me call what I intend to do
A murder, which I thought a sacrifice:
I saw the handkerchief.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: He found it then;
I never gave it him: send for him hither;
Let him confess a truth.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: He hath confess'd.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: What, my lord?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: That he hath used thee.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: How? unlawfully?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Ay.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: He will not say so.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: No, his mouth is stopp'd;
Honest Iago hath ta'en order for't.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: O! my fear interprets: what, is he dead?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Had all his hairs been lives, my great revenge
Had stomach for them all.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: Alas! he is betray'd and I undone.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Out, strumpet! weep'st thou for him to my face?

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: O, banish me, my lord, but kill me not!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Down, strumpet!

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: Kill me to-morrow: let me live to-night!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Nay, if you strive--

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: But half an hour!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Being done, there is no pause.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: But while I say one prayer!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: It is too late.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Within My lord, my lord! what, ho! my lord, my lord!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: What noise is this? Not dead? not yet quite dead?
I that am cruel am yet merciful;
I would not have thee linger in thy pain: So, so.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Within What, ho! my lord, my lord!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Who's there?

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Within O, good my lord, I would speak a word with you!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Yes: 'tis Emilia. By and by. She's dead.
'Tis like she comes to speak of Cassio's death.--
The noise was here. Ha! no more moving?
Still as the grave. Shall she come in? were't good?--
I think she stirs again:--no. What's best to do?
If she come in, she'll sure speak to my wife:
My wife! my wife! what wife? I have no wife.
O insupportable! O heavy hour!
Methinks it should be now a huge eclipse
Of sun and moon, and that the affrighted globe
Should yawn at alteration.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Within I do beseech you
That I may speak with you, O, good my lord!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: I had forgot thee: O, come in, Emilia;
Soft; by and by. Let me the curtains draw.
Where art thou?
What's the matter with thee now?

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: O, my good lord, yonder's foul murders done!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: What, now?

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: But now, my lord.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: It is the very error of the moon;
She comes more nearer earth than she was wont,
And makes men mad.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Cassio, my lord, hath kill'd a young Venetian
Call'd Roderigo.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Roderigo kill'd!
And Cassio kill'd!

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: No, Cassio is not kill'd.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Not Cassio kill'd! then murder's out of tune,
And sweet revenge grows harsh.

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: O, falsely, falsely murder'd!

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Alas, what cry is that?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: That! what?

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Out, and alas! that was my lady's voice.
Help! help, ho! help! O lady, speak again!
Sweet Desdemona! O sweet mistress, speak!

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: A guiltless death I die.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: O, who hath done this deed?

linegroup.speaker: DESDEMONA
linegroup.line: Nobody; I myself. Farewell
Commend me to my kind lord: O, farewell!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Why, how should she be murder'd?

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Alas, who knows?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: You heard her say herself, it was not I.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: She said so: I must needs report the truth.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: She's, like a liar, gone to burning hell:
'Twas I that kill'd her.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: O, the more angel she,
And you the blacker devil!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: She turn'd to folly, and she was a whore.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Thou dost belie her, and thou art a devil.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: She was false as water.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Thou art rash as fire, to say
That she was false: O, she was heavenly true!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Cassio did top her; ask thy husband else.
O, I were damn'd beneath all depth in hell,
But that I did proceed upon just grounds
To this extremity. Thy husband knew it all.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: My husband!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Thy husband.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: That she was false to wedlock?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Ay, with Cassio. Nay, had she been true,
If heaven would make me such another world
Of one entire and Perfect chrysolite,
I'ld not have sold her for it.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: My husband!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Ay, 'twas he that told me first:
An honest man he is, and hates the slime
That sticks on filthy deeds.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: My husband!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: What needs this iteration, woman? I say thy husband.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: O mistress, villany hath made mocks with love,
My husband say that she was false!

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: He, woman;
I say thy husband: dost understand the word?
My friend, thy husband, honest, honest Iago.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: If he say so, may his pernicious soul
Rot half a grain a day! he lies to the heart:
She was too fond of her most filthy bargain.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Ha!

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Do thy worst:
This deed of thine is no more worthy heaven
Than thou wast worthy her.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Peace, you were best.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Thou hast not half that power to do me harm
As I have to be hurt. O gull! O dolt!
As ignorant as dirt! thou hast done a deed--
I care not for thy sword; I'll make thee known,
Though I lost twenty lives.--Help! help, ho! help!
The Moor hath kill'd my mistress! Murder! murder!

section.para: Enter MONTANO, GRATIANO, IAGO, and others

linegroup.speaker: MONTANO
linegroup.line: What is the matter? How now, general!

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: O, are you come, Iago? you have done well,
That men must lay their murders on your neck.

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: What is the matter?

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Disprove this villain, if thou be'st a man:
He says thou told'st him that his wife was false:
I know thou didst not, thou'rt not such a villain:
Speak, for my heart is full.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: I told him what I thought, and told no more
Than what he found himself was apt and true.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: But did you ever tell him she was false?

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: I did.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: You told a lie, an odious, damned lie;
Upon my soul, a lie, a wicked lie.
She false with Cassio!--did you say with Cassio?

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: With Cassio, mistress. Go to, charm your tongue.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: I will not charm my tongue; I am bound to speak:
My mistress here lies murder'd in her bed,--

linegroup.speaker: All
linegroup.line: O heavens forfend!

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: And your reports have set the murder on.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Nay, stare not, masters: it is true, indeed.

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: 'Tis a strange truth.

linegroup.speaker: MONTANO
linegroup.line: O monstrous act!

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Villany, villany, villany!
I think upon't, I think: I smell't: O villany!--
I thought so then:--I'll kill myself for grief:--
O villany, villany!

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: What, are you mad? I charge you, get you home.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Good gentlemen, let me have leave to speak:
'Tis proper I obey him, but not now.
Perchance, Iago, I will ne'er go home.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: O! O! O!

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Nay, lay thee down and roar;
For thou hast kill'd the sweetest innocent
That e'er did lift up eye.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Rising O, she was foul!
I scarce did know you, uncle: there lies your niece,
Whose breath, indeed, these hands have newly stopp'd:
I know this act shows horrible and grim.

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: Poor Desdemona! I am glad thy father's dead:
Thy match was mortal to him, and pure grief
Shore his old thread in twain: did he live now,
This sight would make him do a desperate turn,
Yea, curse his better angel from his side,
And fall to reprobation.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: 'Tis pitiful; but yet Iago knows
That she with Cassio hath the act of shame
A thousand times committed; Cassio confess'd it:
And she did gratify his amorous works
With that recognizance and pledge of love
Which I first gave her; I saw it in his hand:
It was a handkerchief, an antique token
My father gave my mother.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: O heaven! O heavenly powers!

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Come, hold your peace.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: 'Twill out, 'twill out: I peace!
No, I will speak as liberal as the north:
Let heaven and men and devils, let them all,
All, all, cry shame against me, yet I'll speak.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Be wise, and get you home.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: I will not.

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: Fie!
Your sword upon a woman?

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: O thou dull Moor! that handkerchief thou speak'st of
I found by fortune and did give my husband;
For often, with a solemn earnestness,
More than indeed belong'd to such a trifle,
He begg'd of me to steal it.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Villanous whore!

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: She give it Cassio! no, alas! I found it,
And I did give't my husband.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Filth, thou liest!

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: By heaven, I do not, I do not, gentlemen.
O murderous coxcomb! what should such a fool
Do with so good a woman?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Are there no stones in heaven
But what serve for the thunder?--Precious villain!

section.para: He runs at IAGO IAGO, from behind, stabs EMILIA, and exit

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: The woman falls; sure, he hath kill'd his wife.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: Ay, ay: O, lay me by my mistress' side.

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: He's gone, but his wife's kill'd.

linegroup.speaker: MONTANO
linegroup.line: 'Tis a notorious villain. Take you this weapon,
Which I have here recover'd from the Moor:
Come, guard the door without; let him not pass,
But kill him rather. I'll after that same villain,
For 'tis a damned slave.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: I am not valiant neither,
But ever puny whipster gets my sword:
But why should honour outlive honesty?
Let it go all.

linegroup.speaker: EMILIA
linegroup.line: What did thy song bode, lady?
Hark, canst thou hear me? I will play the swan.
And die in music.
Willow, willow, willow,--
Moor, she was chaste; she loved thee, cruel Moor;
So come my soul to bliss, as I speak true;
So speaking as I think, I die, I die.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: I have another weapon in this chamber;
It is a sword of Spain, the ice-brook's temper:--
O, here it is. Uncle, I must come forth.

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: Within If thou attempt it, it will cost thee dear:
Thou hast no weapon, and perforce must suffer.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Look in upon me then and speak with me,
Or, naked as I am, I will assault thee.

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: What is the matter?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Behold, I have a weapon;
A better never did itself sustain
Upon a soldier's thigh: I have seen the day,
That, with this little arm and this good sword,
I have made my way through more impediments
Than twenty times your stop: but, O vain boast!
Who can control his fate? 'tis not so now.
Be not afraid, though you do see me weapon'd;
Here is my journey's end, here is my butt,
And very sea-mark of my utmost sail.
Do you go back dismay'd? 'tis a lost fear;
Man but a rush against Othello's breast,
And he retires. Where should Othello go?
Now, how dost thou look now? O ill-starr'd wench!
Pale as thy smock! when we shall meet at compt,
This look of thine will hurl my soul from heaven,
And fiends will snatch at it. Cold, cold, my girl!
Even like thy chastity. O cursed slave!
Whip me, ye devils,
From the possession of this heavenly sight!
Blow me about in winds! roast me in sulphur!
Wash me in steep-down gulfs of liquid fire!
O Desdemona! Desdemona! dead!
Oh! Oh! Oh!

section.para: Enter LODOVICO. MONTANO, CASSIO carried in a chair, and Officers with IAGO, prisoner

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: Where is this rash and most unfortunate man?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: That's he that was Othello: here I am.

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: Where is that viper? bring the villain forth.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: I look down towards his feet; but that's a fable.
If that thou best a devil, I cannot kill thee.

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: Wrench his sword from him.

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: I bleed, sir; but not kill'd.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: I am not sorry neither: I'ld have thee live;
For, in my sense, 'tis happiness to die.

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: O thou Othello, thou wert once so good,
Fall'n in the practise of a damned slave,
What shall be said to thee?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Why, any thing:
An honourable murderer, if you will;
For nought I did in hate, but all in honour.

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: This wretch hath part confess'd his villany:
Did you and he consent in Cassio's death?

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Ay.

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: Dear general, I never gave you cause.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: I do believe it, and I ask your pardon.
Will you, I pray, demand that demi-devil
Why he hath thus ensnared my soul and body?

linegroup.speaker: IAGO
linegroup.line: Demand me nothing: what you know, you know:
From this time forth I never will speak word.

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: What, not to pray?

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: Torments will ope your lips.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Well, thou dost best.

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: Sir, you shall understand what hath befall'n,
Which, as I think, you know not. Here is a letter
Found in the pocket of the slain Roderigo;
And here another: the one of them imports
The death of Cassio to be undertook
By Roderigo.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: O villain!

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: Most heathenish and most gross!

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: Now here's another discontented paper,
Found in his pocket too; and this, it seems,
Roderigo meant to have sent this damned villain;
But that belike Iago in the interim
Came in and satisfied him.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: O the pernicious caitiff!
How came you, Cassio, by that handkerchief
That was my wife's?

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: I found it in my chamber:
And he himself confess'd but even now
That there he dropp'd it for a special purpose
Which wrought to his desire.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: O fool! fool! fool!

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: There is besides in Roderigo's letter,
How he upbraids Iago, that he made him
Brave me upon the watch; whereon it came
That I was cast: and even but now he spake,
After long seeming dead, Iago hurt him,
Iago set him on.

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: You must forsake this room, and go with us:
Your power and your command is taken off,
And Cassio rules in Cyprus. For this slave,
If there be any cunning cruelty
That can torment him much and hold him long,
It shall be his. You shall close prisoner rest,
Till that the nature of your fault be known
To the Venetian state. Come, bring him away.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: Soft you; a word or two before you go.
I have done the state some service, and they know't.
No more of that. I pray you, in your letters,
When you shall these unlucky deeds relate,
Speak of me as I am; nothing extenuate,
Nor set down aught in malice: then must you speak
Of one that loved not wisely but too well;
Of one not easily jealous, but being wrought
Perplex'd in the extreme; of one whose hand,
Like the base Indian, threw a pearl away
Richer than all his tribe; of one whose subdued eyes,
Albeit unused to the melting mood,
Drop tears as fast as the Arabian trees
Their medicinal gum. Set you down this;
And say besides, that in Aleppo once,
Where a malignant and a turban'd Turk
Beat a Venetian and traduced the state,
I took by the throat the circumcised dog,
And smote him, thus.

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: O bloody period!

linegroup.speaker: GRATIANO
linegroup.line: All that's spoke is marr'd.

linegroup.speaker: OTHELLO
linegroup.line: I kiss'd thee ere I kill'd thee: no way but this;
Killing myself, to die upon a kiss.

section.para: Falls on the bed, and dies

linegroup.speaker: CASSIO
linegroup.line: This did I fear, but thought he had no weapon;
For he was great of heart.

linegroup.speaker: LODOVICO
linegroup.line: To IAGO O Spartan dog,
More fell than anguish, hunger, or the sea!
Look on the tragic loading of this bed;
This is thy work: the object poisons sight;
Let it be hid. Gratiano, keep the house,
And seize upon the fortunes of the Moor,
For they succeed on you. To you, lord governor,
Remains the censure of this hellish villain;
The time, the place, the torture: O, enforce it!
Myself will straight aboard: and to the state
This heavy act with heavy heart relate.
